The dealer is required to hit on any total of 16 or less and must stand once they reach 17 or higher.
There is no splitting cards in this game. Play doubles straight up.
If the dealer shows 7 or higher, play with caution. They can often reach 17+ and take your money. Which is no good for you.
Doubling Down on 10 or 11 can be a strong move when the dealer has a weak upcard. Increase your chance for more winnings!
A natural blackjack (Ace + 10-value card) pays 1.5x your bet and is an instant win unless the dealer also has a blackjack.
Hit means you want another card. Stand means you want to keep your current total and end your turn. Hit as much as you want, just don't bust!
